N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 8 ยง 587.3 - General provisions

State Regulations
(a) Driver
responsibility. (1)

The person registering a
private vehicle for use on a University property is responsible for its
operation and for any fines incurred under this Part during or due to their
presence on University properties. (2)

By registering a vehicle for University
property parking privileges, a person agrees to abide by the traffic and
parking regulations in force at that time, and any subsequent regulation that
may be issued. The assignee of a State-owned vehicle is responsible for its
operation and for any fines incurred under this Part during the period of
assignment. (b) Registration of vehicles. (1)

Any State

University Plaza personnel who operates a vehicle on University property must
register that vehicle with the Parking Garage Office at System

Administration. (2)

Vehicle
registration entitles a person to drive on University property and to park in
designated parking places only. (3)

System Administration shall issue an official parking identification to be
displayed in a manner as approved by the Chancellor or designee. (4)
A vehicle is considered registered only
when the official System Administration parking identification is visibly
displayed and legible. (5)

The
official System Administration parking identification shall be removed and
returned to the Parking Garage Office upon change of ownership and shall be
surrendered upon termination of the registrant's association with System

Administration. (6)

Stolen or lost
parking identification must be reported to the Parking Garage Office. Should
the owner of the parking identification wish to seek a replacement, it may be
the responsibility of the owner to purchase a new one. (7)

Reproduction or copying of official
parking identification is prohibited. (8)

Contractors and vendors who are granted
parking privileges may be required to obtain daily or monthly parking
identification at a charge as approved by the Chancellor or designee. (c) Fees. Parking fees or other fees as approved by the Chancellor, or designee, shall be charged for motor vehicles parking within the garage or
designated lots, consistent with applicable collective bargaining
agreements. (d) Obedience
to University police officers and traffic control devices. No person shall fail, neglect, or refuse to comply with
or obey the direction or command of any University police officer, or fail, neglect, or refuse to comply with or obey any instruction or direction, regulation, warning, or prohibition written or printed, displayed or appearing
on any traffic or parking sign or placard on any part of University property. The directions on any such sign or placard may be disregarded only on order of
a University police officer. (e) Temporary instructions. Special short-term conditions arise that may require
suspending a portion of these rules and regulations or may require additional, temporary regulations and/or instruction. The chief of University police, or
designee, shall be authorized to take such temporary actions as circumstances
may dictate. Notes
